comments:
I20050214-0927

While debugging, I tried to open a collection field in the variables view. I got
the exception below, no matter whether I enabled logical structures or not.

I was running on an 1.5 vm. The collection's type was ArrayList<E>.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-02-15 13:21:44.540
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Fetching children from debug target".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 0
	at

	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)


The exception was also accompanied by a StringIndexOutOfBoundsException (not
sure whether this is related):

ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-02-15 13:22:25.532
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Debug".
!STACK 0
java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: -2
	at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1444)
	at

Fixed.
A generic method signature not always have type parameters. Added a test to
check if there are type parameters or not.

Changes in BinaryBasedSourceGenerator.
